intro: Suttonia mauiensis, commonly known as the Maui dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and dry, sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Suttonia mauiensis has small, yellowish-green leaves and produces fluffy, white seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
